channel.title: Slighty updated RSC Community Landscape Editor
channel.description:
Code available at http://code.google.com/p/3d-map-editor/ Pre-built: http://www.darkq.org/editor.zip
[b]Changes:[/b] Right click now only shows tile info. Left click changes the tile. Ability to make your own brush. [img]http://i41.tinypic.com/5x1kpy.png[/img]
[b]How does this system work?[/b] Left click on a tile, if you want to edit it, click "load data". It will load all the tiles info to the sliders. Change the sliders and simply click (or drag) on the tile you wish to set the new settings to.
[b]Credits[/b] [i]Mostly[/i] xEnt, [i]bit[/i] Vrunk & me.
Enjoy.

that means there’s water but i cant see it…[/quote]

item.title: Slighty updated RSC Community Landscape Editor
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“pesterd, post:13, topic:259594”][quote author=Love Classic link=topic=342812.msg2653444#msg2653444 date=1233689376]
I Edited my landscape, when i log in. nothing changed.
When i load landscape in landscape editor, its still edited…

[/quote]

you have to reset server and compress it into the server[/quote]

That needs to be done to make all the walls etc workable, but does not answer his query.

[quote=“xEnt, post:14, topic:259594”][quote author=Love Classic link=topic=342812.msg2653444#msg2653444 date=1233689376]
I Edited my landscape, when i log in. nothing changed.
When i load landscape in landscape editor, its still edited…

[/quote]
Are you 100% sure the landscape file your editing, belongs to the client your launching?[/quote]

What he said.

Read full topic
